text:
CONTRACT  ROUTE  Dig. SECTION 1  No. 5
LOCATION  Chatham Square
SUBJECT  Construction Photo.
DESCRIPTION  Sidewalk on west side  Looking South
DATE  Dec. 23, 1914

Purchased from Neikrug Galleries, Inc., May 25, 1976
title: Manhattan: Chatham Square

text:
A Chatham Square view as seen from the east side of square at Pearl Street and East Broadway. A Third Avenue Surface car is shown in the foreground, stopping here enroute to the United States Post Office via the Bowery.

March 6, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, from a different angle.

September 30, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

A view southwestward from the northern side of the Square.
About 1936.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.

A Chatham Square view as seen from the east side of square at Pearl Street and East Broadway. A Third Avenue Surface car is shown in the foreground, stopping here enroute to the United States Post Office via the Bowery.

March 6, 1934.

A Chatham Square view as seen from the east side of square at Pearl Street and East Broadway. A Third Avenue Surface car is shown in the foreground, stopping here enroute to the United States Post Office via the Bowery.

September 30, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

A view southwestward from the northern side of the Square.
About 1936.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.

Oliver Street, east side, north from South Street to Chatham Square.
May 3, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Chatham Square, west side, north from (about No. 7), from a point between Mott and Doyers Streets and towards the latter. The street forms the west side of the connecting link between Park Row and the Bowery; the latter starting at the end. Note the Third Avenue "E1" overhead and which follows the Bowery northward.

October 8, 1933

P. L. Sperr

(2) A portion of the same and showing mainly, No. 11 Chatham Square, a barber shop just south of Doyers Street.

October 8, 1933.

P. L. Sperr

(3) Chatham Square "L", looking North, West side of Mott Street. At #7-9 may be seen the Port Arthur Tavern, and towards the bend in Street the tower on the R.C. church of the Transfiguration.

April 8th, 1941.

P.L.Sperr,

(1) Chatham Square, west side, north from (about No. 7), from a point between Mott and Doyers Streets and towards the latter. The street forms the west side of the connecting link between Park Row and the Bowery; the latter starting at the end. Note the Third Avenue "E1" overhead and which follows the Bowery northward.

October 8, 1933

P. L. Sperr

(2) A portion of the same and showing mainly, No. 11 Chatham Square, a barber shop just south of Doyers Street.

October 8, 1933.

P. L. Sperr

(3) Chatham Square "L", looking North, West side of Mott Street. At #7-9 may be seen the Port Arthur Tavern, and towards the bend in Street the tower on the R.C. church of the Transfiguration.

April 8th, 1941.

P.L.Sperr,

(1) Chatham Square, west side, north from (about No. 7), from a point between Mott and Doyers Streets and towards the latter. The street forms the west side of the connecting link between Park Row and the Bowery; the latter starting at the end. Note the Third Avenue "E1" overhead and which follows the Bowery northward.

October 8, 1933

P. L. Sperr

(2) A portion of the same and showing mainly, No. 11 Chatham Square, a barber shop just south of Doyers Street.

October 8, 1933.

P. L. Sperr

(3) Chatham Square "L", looking North, West side of Mott Street. At #7-9 may be seen the Port Arthur Tavern, and towards the bend in Street the tower on the R.C. church of the Transfiguration.

April 8th, 1941.

P.L.Sperr,

1. Chatham Square, showing "El" tracks at square, and the Municipal Building in the background.
2. Chatham Square, 3rd Avenue "El" train to City Hall.
3. Chatham Square "El" tracks and station from north end.

P. L. Sperr
April 8, 1941
Views 1, 2, 3
